Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Selective entry into macropores and specific capture by immobilized FcRn ligands.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Binding at pH 6.0, elution at pH 7.4, 37 Â°C.
Other Information.Additional Info: FcRn-binding affinity enables selective extraction of IgG.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion effect, as molecules are larger than pore apertures.

Other Information.Additional Info: Effectively excluded particles larger than approximately 300 nm.

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving for impurities (size exclusion) combined with specific affinity binding for target biomacromolecules (IgG) within macropores.

Experimental Validation.Method: Nanoparticle tracking analysis (NTA), SEC column pressure monitoring, Enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA), Scanning electron microscopy (SEM), Transmission electron microscopy (TEM), Fourier transform infrared (FT-IR) spectroscopy, X-ray diffraction (XRD).
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: 36.6% reduction in particle count (300-600 nm size range) in the eluate compared to nonporous material; significantly slower increase in SEC column pressure; successful FcRn immobilization with preserved IgG binding affinity; good reusability and inter-batch reproducibility (12.7%-13.9% RSD).

Other Information.Additional Info: Custom-designed material derived from MZIF-8. Features an exterior polydopamine (PDA) layer for enhanced acid stability, biocompatibility, and ligand conjugation. Possesses magnetic properties for rapid separation. Represents the first application of macroporous materials for size-exclusion extraction of biomacromolecules in complex biological matrices (HCCF samples).
